content:
he was walking down the street when it happened  water was thrown on him and a voice said Go back to your homeland. the incident occurred at about  p.m PERIOD Tuesday on the  block of East College Avenue the State College Police Department said PERIOD

A 22yearold man said water was thrown on him from the window of a Hetzel Plaza apartment police said PERIOD

The harassed man is reportedly the president of the Sigma Lambda Beta fraternity PERIOD According to a letter circulated on Twitter the organization  which was founded as asocial fraternity with an emphasis on Latino culture  said its president was a victim of a hate crime. the letter said a group of white males approached the man but the police did not corroborate those details PERIOD

Police said they are still looking for the suspects and will be trying to obtain any surveillance video from the area PERIOD

A reward of up to  is being offered for information leading to the arrest and conviction of those responsible for this incident PERIOD

State College Police have logged the report as harassment PERIOD But due to the wording of the suspects comment and the mans ethnicity there is a possibility this could rise to the level of ethnic intimidation State College Police Lt PERIOD Keith Robb said PERIOD

In Pennsylvania he said hate crimes fall under ethnic intimidation PERIOD

Detectives will interview the man harassed as well as those responsible once their identities are discovered and determine the motivation for the crime Robb said PERIOD

The comments made would indicate ethnicity probably played a role Robb said but that is yet to be determined. while the incident occurred downtown where State College Police has jurisdiction Penn State Police will be assisting in the investigation PERIOD

The university is also aware of the incident and the fraternitys letter Penn State spokeswoman Lisa Powers said via email PERIOD

We are deeply concerned for the safety and wellbeing of our students Powers said and will not allow hatred and bigotry to fester. in the fraternitys letter they asserted this incident was indicative of an endemic problem at Penn State PERIOD

In the letter the organization discussed racially insensitive tweets after last weeks diein protests around campus a tweet sent last fall about minority students in the HUBRobeson Center and the incident in which a sorority hosted  and posted pictures online of  a Mexican party PERIOD

The university needs to be more aware of the views of its students so they can be addressed appropriately in an educated tolerant and respectful forum where all sides of the argument can be voiced and heard equally the letter read PERIOD

Last week university administrators did send a letter calling for civility as the protests  a response to a grand jurys decision not to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the killing of unarmed teenager Michael Brown in Ferguson Missouri  continued on campus PERIOD

But it is not only a Penn State problem the fraternity said in the letter PERIOD

Racism occurs on college campuses every day the letter read and much goes unreported PERIOD

A diversity officer and counselor Powers said is planning to contact the student who reported the incident and learn more about what occurred PERIOD

Dr PERIOD Barron and his senior leaders are concerned about this incident as well as any other similar incidents and are working on ways to help foster a campus community atmosphere based on civility respect and inclusion Powers said PERIOD We want to let our community know that any act of bias violence or hate is unacceptable and creates a barrier to our educational mission. anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact the State College Police Department at   PERIOD
